meanings.definition: A person who stands, especially in a crowded public place.
meanings.sent1: The standees waited patiently in line for the concert tickets.
meanings.sent2: The standees at the bus stop were eager to board the bus.
meanings.sent3: The standees in the park enjoyed the sunny weather while chatting with friends.
meanings.sent4: The standees in the subway resembled a forest of tall trees.
meanings.sent5: The standees outside the store formed a colorful mosaic of people.

meanings.definition: A cardboard or metal display used to advertise a product or event.
meanings.sent1: The standees of the new movie were eye-catching in the cinema lobby.
meanings.sent2: The standees for the upcoming concert displayed vibrant images of the band.
meanings.sent3: The standees in the store window attracted customers with their bold designs.
meanings.sent4: The standees at the trade show booth drew attention from all directions.
meanings.sent5: The standees promoting the sale stood proudly at the entrance of the mall.

meanings.definition: The act of standing, especially as a form of protest or support.
meanings.sent1: The standees outside the government building demanded change through their presence.
meanings.sent2: The standees at the rally raised their voices for a cause they believed in.
meanings.sent3: The standees in the square stood united in their call for justice.
meanings.sent4: The standees for equality stood firm in the face of adversity.
meanings.sent5: The standees for the environment stood tall against pollution.
